page.title: 03Gt.Waldingfield 50 years ago
page.content: Until the present school was built in 1970 there was a Victorian school near the church.The village then,was mostly near the church with a blacksmith's shop and a post office.In the last 40 years the village centre has moved and is now close to the Sudbury and Lavenham road.The old village is a quiet walk from where most people live now. Another old part of the village is Garrison Lane,and this has not changed much.There used to be a farm there which supplied the village with milk which was taken round by pony and cart. There has been pig farming in the village for years and there used to be a slaughter house where Chestnut Close now stands.
